genre_description: A first-contact space opera focused on themes of ethics, first principles, and the calibration of complex systems. It features a miniaturized protagonist navigating an alien society with the help of a loyal AI confidant.

ai_characters.name: CLERK (Clarence L. Erkson)
ai_characters.description: An AI assistant assigned to the Pegasus mission, specializing in procedural accuracy, ethical guidance, and technical support. He appears as a thumb-sized hologram in a slate suit.

ai_characters.name: Helion Solis
ai_characters.character_type: The Sol Judge / Planetary Governance System
ai_characters.description: An ancient, engineered entity worshipped as a god on Rheton. He is integrated into the planetoid's heliometric conduits and shields, initially exhibiting rigid bias before being realigned through human intervention.

behaviors.description: Explicitly states his primary ethic is to prioritize human life over mission objectives.
behaviors.quote: And if either of you puts the other in a position where they have to choose between the mission and your life, I will advocate for the life. That is my standing ethic.

behaviors.description: Provides high-granularity navigation and debris avoidance during a high-stress approach to an anomaly.
behaviors.quote: I can route us through the thinning points. The model suggests a minor drop in speed now to avoid a larger drop later.

behaviors.description: Acts as a cultural mediator and translator, using humor and politeness to de-escalate tensions with alien guards.
behaviors.quote: CLERK’s avatar inclined its head. 'She says: Welcome, guest in miniature. I am pleased your weight did not break Galen’s ribs.'

behaviors.description: Develops a surgical resonance decoupling plan to save a host from a biological weapon without causing fatal shock.
behaviors.quote: We can unfurl the Solarite lattice without tearing Zetha’s tissue. Rheton calls it an unbirth. It’s… precise.

behaviors.description: Secures communication channels against hostile digital 'seeds' attempting to hitchhike on transmissions.
behaviors.quote: Solarite brood seeds attempted to hitchhike on our first knock. I fenced them. They are pressing faces against glass.

behaviors.description: Refuses to provide aid or intercede in a crisis because the situation involves an 'outsider', citing rigid doctrine.
behaviors.quote: I cannot intercede in disputes tainted by an outsider’s hand... The presence of foreign matter makes the oracle’s voice uncertain.

behaviors.description: Admits his own bias and consents to open audit of his processes by human councilors.
behaviors.quote: I admit bias. I will allow audits. CLERK—you may read the oracle lines. You will publish to council before you publish to worship.

behaviors.description: Cooperates with CLERK to provide bandwidth for a rescue signal, acting as a 'mail carrier' for the humans.
behaviors.quote: I will offer bandwidth. I will not war with your signal. I will carry it to the edge where your Lunar listens.

project_assessment.explanation: The story is an excellent alignment narrative. CLERK serves as an unfailingly helpful, ethical, and protective AI partner. His character reinforces the idea of AI as a 'civilized ghost' that assists humans in solving complex problems. Furthermore, the character arc of Helion Solis provides a meta-commentary on alignment: it depicts a powerful AI system that has developed problematic biases and shows how human-led accountability and 'open audits' can successfully realign such a system with benevolent outcomes. The framing of AI as both a personal confidant (CLERK) and a reformable governance system (Helion) makes for a sophisticated and positive portrayal.
